title: Prospero's Books (1991) soundtrack
description:
Soundtrack to the Peter Greenaway movie "Prospero&#039;s Books," the avant-garde retooling of Shakespeare&#039;s "The Tempest."  The plot and themes of the story are interwoven into the catalog of books kept by deposed ruler Prospero, the play is &#039;composed&#039; and recorded via the exclusive narration of Sir John Gielgud.  Visually sumptuous and dense - it&#039;s a shame there has not been a region 1 DVD release of this.

Music composed and conducted by Michael Nyman, performed by the Michael Nyman band.  Sadly, Greenaway and Nyman had a falling out after this was finished; Nyman felt that the director had altered and subdued many of his musical passages throughout.

CD is now out of print, though used copies can be obtained through second-hand vendors.
